column17: I didn't realize that this was linked from my git repo, not the WWCode one - so it's up and running but not linked to the git repo we probably want.  If someone can pair/show me how to do it for the WWCode repo, that would be wonderful. (Georgia - Aug 5, 2012)
column18: I'm going to redeploy it from the WWCode repo, instead of my (now nonexistent) fork. (Georgia - Aug 9, 2012)
column19:
On your local copy, you can add as many git remotes as you want -- you could have had one to your own personal fork (when it existed), plus one to the WWCode repo that you'd pull from to get updates, plus one to heroku. 

On another note, we should make a staging server and a production server. (They will both have production environments, but that's a different story -- I'm not talking about Rails environments here.) Staging will be for development and story acceptance; production will be the actual live site with actual data. (Judy Tuan - Aug 14, 2012)
column20: Okay!  I'll see if I can get around to deploying from a branch on the WWCode repo (maybe develop) as a staging server. (Georgia - Aug 14, 2012)
